step1.title: Create a Project
step1.description:
To get started, create your first project. You only need to give it a name, indicate what stage it's in, and then you can define how you want to manage the team's governance and finances.

You can review each option in detail and adjust the configuration to reflect how you work today. If any aspect doesn't fit your actual practices, write to us: we can help you or prepare new configurations for your case.

step2.title: Invite Your Contributors
step2.description:
With the project created, the next step is to invite the people who are part of the team.

At any time you can go to:
My Projects → Select the project → Contributors

Enter the email and we'll send an automatic invitation. They'll have three days to accept it and, once they do, they'll appear in the list of active contributors.

step3.title: Integrate Your Management Tool
step3.description:
In the Integrations tab you'll find the available options to connect your management tool, or you can vote for yours to prioritize its incorporation.

Depending on each tool, you'll see these actions:

Before configuring:
- Install: if the tool requires a plugin or additional technical step, here you'll find the instructions.
- Register: guided process to authorize the integration and map users between the tool and AngoraSix.

Once configured:
- Sync: manually update data if something changed in your tool.
- View status: review the integration status and detail of imported tasks.
- Reconfigure: modify the connection when you need to.
- Associate users: update the user mapping.
- Disable: disconnect the integration.

step4.title: View the Project's Ownership Distribution
step4.description:
With the integration running, you can go to the Dashboard tab to see how the ownership distribution evolves based on recorded contributions. You'll also find key project metrics and your own contributions.

While we work on even more integrated support, this visualization can help you make decisions, manage financial agreements, and evaluate how the project evolves over time.

Additionally, we recommend adopting a methodology that allows you to review and adjust ownership management iteratively.
